text: Puerto Rico competed in the Winter Olympic Games for the first time at the 1984 Winter Olympics in Sarajevo, Yugoslavia. The country's only representative was George Tucker, who finished last in the luge event."Puerto Rico at the 1984 Calgary Winter Games", Sports References"Losers Of Renown", Sports Illustrated, January 27, 1988 == Luge== ;Men {|class="wikitable" border="1" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !colspan="2"|Run 1 !colspan="2"|Run 2 !colspan="2"|Run 3 !colspan="2"|Run 4 !colspan="2"|Total |- !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |George Tucker |align="center"|53.962 |align="center"|31 |align="center"|52.907 |align="center"|31 |align="center"|53.271 |align="center"|31 |align="center"|52.873 |align="center"|30 |align="center"|3:33.013 |align="center"|30 |} ==References== *Official Olympic Reports * Olympic Winter Games 1984, full results by sports-reference.com Category:1984 in Puerto Rican sports Category:Nations at the 1984 Winter Olympics 1984 Winter Olympics
title: Puerto Rico at the 1984 Winter Olympics
